info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 12 at 3:19PM CDT until July 12 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
FFWSJT
The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Jones County in west central Texas... Shackelford County in west central Texas...
* Until 515 PM CDT.
* At 317 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain nearly stationary from Avoca in Jone County to near Ft Griffin in Shackelford County. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen with another 2 inches possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Stamford, Albany, Lueders, Fort Griffin, Avoca, Mccarty Lake, Big Country Baptist Assembly and The Intersection Of Us-180 And Farm Road 600.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 5:15 PM CDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD WARNING is in effect for this area until 5:15 PM CDT. This is a dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 5:15 PM CDT. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 5:15 PM CDT. Esta es una situacion peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
